intro: Tragacantha rariflora, commonly known as the rare thorned tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive spiny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by seed pods that contain numerous small, hard seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through deep root systems and water-storing tissues. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
